description: Single storey side extension (following demolition of existing garage and garden studio); single storey rear infill extension (following removal of existing bay window); replacement of all existing windows; replacement of door to rear elevation; alterations to front porch; and alteration to front boundary wall to widen driveway entrance.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): A 01(artistic image of proposed scheme); A 02 (floor plans, 1 of 2, existing and proposed); A 03 (site plan, existing and proposed); A 04 (elevations, 1 of 2: Front and rear current and proposed); A 05 (elevations, 2 of 2: sides, current and proposed); A (block plan and lamppost map)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall be "conservation-grade", not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Creffield Conservation Area Management Plan.

| The windows inserted in the side elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
